tier_2_material.victim_details: Child victim, friend of the daughter of the accused
tier_2_material.weapon_used: Manual compressive and ligature constrictive strangulation

tier_3_contextual.circumstances_of_killing: The accused committed forcible and violent sexual assault on the child victim and then strangled her

tier_4_procedural.case_title: Abdul Nassar v. State of Kerala & Anr.

residual_details.additional_facts: The prosecution proved the case with circumstantial evidence including DNA evidence linking the accused to the crime. The accused expired during the pendency of the appeals, and the legal heirs applied for continuation of the appeals under section 394(2) CrPC.
